019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.io.File;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.io.InputStreamReader;
024import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
025import java.io.Reader;
026import java.io.Writer;
027import java.nio.file.Files;
028import java.util.HashMap;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import java.util.StringTokenizer;
032import java.util.prefs.BackingStoreException;
033import org.jdrupes.json.JsonBeanDecoder;
034import org.jdrupes.json.JsonBeanEncoder;
035import org.jdrupes.json.JsonDecodeException;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
038import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
040import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
041import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
042import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialConfiguration;
043import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialPreferences;
044
045/**
046 * This component provides a store for an application's configuration
047 * backed by a JSON file. The JSON object described by this file 
048 * represents the root directory. If an entry does not start with a
049 * slash, it represents the key of a key value pair. If it does
050 * starts with a slash, the value is another JSON object that
051 * describes the respective subdirectory.
052 * 
053 * The component reads the initial values from {@link File} passed
054 * to the constructor. During application bootstrap, it 
055 * intercepts the {@link Start} event using a handler with  priority 
056 * 999999. When receiving this event, it fires all known preferences 
057 * values on the channels of the start event as a 
058 * {@link InitialPreferences} event, using a new {@link EventPipeline}
059 * and waiting for its completion. Then, allows the intercepted 
060 * {@link Start} event to continue. 
061 * 
062 * Components that depend on configuration values define handlers
063 * for {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events and adapt themselves to the values 
064 * received. Note that due to the intercepted {@link Start} event, the initial
065 * preferences values are received before the {@link Start} event, so
066 * components' configurations can be rearranged before they actually
067 * start doing something.
068 *
069 * Besides initially publishing the stored preferences values,
070 * the component also listens for {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events
071 * on its channel and updates the JSON file (may be suppressed).
072 */
073public class JsonConfigurationStore extends Component {
074
075    private File file;
076    private Map<String, Object> cache;
077
078    /**
079     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
080     * channel and the given file.
081     * 
082     * @param componentChannel the channel 
083     * @param file the file used to store the JSON
084     * @throws JsonDecodeException
085     */
086    public JsonConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel, File file)
087            throws IOException {
088        this(componentChannel, file, true);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
093     * channel and the given file.
094     * 
095     * @param componentChannel the channel 
096     * @param file the file used to store the JSON
097     * @throws JsonDecodeException
098     */
099    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
100    public JsonConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel, File file,
101            boolean update) throws IOException {
102        super(componentChannel);
103        if (update) {
104            Handler.Evaluator.add(this, "onConfigurationUpdate",
105                channel().defaultCriterion());
106        }
107        this.file = file;
108        if (!file.exists()) {
109            cache = new HashMap<>();
110            return;
111        }
112        try (Reader in = new InputStreamReader(
113            Files.newInputStream(file.toPath()), "utf-8")) {
114            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
115            Map<String, Object> confCache
116                = (Map<String, Object>) JsonBeanDecoder.create(in).readObject();
117            cache = confCache;
118        } catch (JsonDecodeException e) {
119            throw new IOException(e);
120        }
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Intercepts the {@link Start} event and fires a
125     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event.
126     *
127     * @param event the event
128     * @throws BackingStoreException the backing store exception
129     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
130     */
131    @Handler(priority = 999_999, channels = Channel.class)
132    public void onStart(Start event)
133            throws BackingStoreException, InterruptedException {
134        ConfigurationUpdate updEvt = new InitialConfiguration();
135        addPrefs(updEvt, "/", cache);
136        newEventPipeline().fire(updEvt, event.channels()).get();
137    }
138
139    private void addPrefs(
140            ConfigurationUpdate updEvt, String path, Map<String, ?> map) {
141        for (Map.Entry<String, ?> e : map.entrySet()) {
142            if (e.getValue() instanceof Map) {
143                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
144                Map<String, ?> value = (Map<String, ?>) e.getValue();
145                addPrefs(updEvt, ("/".equals(path) ? "" : path)
146                    + e.getKey(), value);
147                continue;
148            }
149            updEvt.add(path, e.getKey(), e.getValue().toString());
150        }
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Merges and saves configuration updates.
155     *
156     * @param event the event
157     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
158     */
159    @Handler(dynamic = true)
160    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis",
161        "PMD.AvoidLiteralsInIfCondition",
162        "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops" })
163    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event)
164            throws IOException {
165        boolean changed = false;
166        for (String path : event.paths()) {
167            if ("/".equals(path) && !event.values(path).isPresent()) {
168                // Special case, "remove root", i.e. all configuration data
169                cache.clear();
170                changed = true;
171            }
172            changed = changed || handleSegment(cache,
173                new StringTokenizer(path, "/"), event.values(path));
174        }
175        if (changed) {
176            try (Writer out = new OutputStreamWriter(
177                Files.newOutputStream(file.toPath()), "utf-8");
178                    JsonBeanEncoder enc = JsonBeanEncoder.create(out)) {
179                enc.writeObject(cache);
180            }
181        }
182    }
183
184    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
185    private boolean handleSegment(Map<String, Object> currentMap,
186            StringTokenizer tokenizer, Optional<Map<String, String>> values) {
187        if (!tokenizer.hasMoreTokens()) {
188            // "Leave" map
189            return mergeValues(currentMap, values.get());
190        }
191        boolean changed = false;
192        String nextSegment = "/" + tokenizer.nextToken();
193        if (!tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() && !values.isPresent()) {
194            // Next segment is last segment from path and we must remove
195            if (currentMap.containsKey(nextSegment)) {
196                // Delete sub-map.
197                currentMap.remove(nextSegment);
198                changed = true;
199            }
200            return changed;
201        }
202        // Check if next map exists
203        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
204        Map<String, Object> nextMap
205            = (Map<String, Object>) currentMap.get(nextSegment);
206        if (nextMap == null) {
207            // Doesn't exist, new sub-map
208            changed = true;
209            nextMap = new HashMap<>();
210            currentMap.put(nextSegment, nextMap);
211        }
212        // Continue with sub-map
213        return changed || handleSegment(nextMap, tokenizer, values);
214    }
215
216    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
217    private boolean mergeValues(Map<String, Object> currentMap,
218            Map<String, String> values) {
219        boolean changed = false;
220        for (Map.Entry<String, String> e : values.entrySet()) {
221            if (e.getValue() == null) {
222                // Delete from map
223                if (currentMap.containsKey(e.getKey())) {
224                    currentMap.remove(e.getKey());
225                    changed = true;
226                }
227                continue;
228            }
229            String oldValue = Optional.ofNullable(currentMap.get(e.getKey()))
230                .map(val -> val.toString()).orElse(null);
231            if (oldValue == null || !e.getValue().equals(oldValue)) {
232                currentMap.put(e.getKey(), e.getValue());
233                changed = true;
234            }
235        }
236        return changed;
237    }
238}
